fields.summary: Android: Debugger does not hit breakpoint for an alloy app on a device.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description:
h5.Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a default alloy app.
2. Set the breakpoint at line 2 in index.js
3. Debug on android device.

h5.Actual results:
1. The debugger stops on line 2 on the mapped index.js (screenshot attached) & stays on the splash screen.
2. Hitting play, the app window is visible but clicking on the label does not stop on the intended breakpoint.
3. Works fine with classic app.

h5.Expected result:
1. The debugger should stop on the intended breakpoint.
fields.summary: Android: Debugger does not hit breakpoint for an alloy app on a device.

comments.body:
FR Passed.
Debug on alloy and classic projects works for both android device and emulator.

Closing ticket fix verified in SDK Version {{8.3.0.v20191120160657}}, {{9.0.0.v20191120161007}}.

Test and other information can be found at:
